body:
> This isn't really what I had expected. This creates an interesting parallel history for a recipe, sort of?

Yeah it wasn't what I was originally thinking but then I started running through workflows and this seems like the best way to handle it.

> (Though maybe we should change so that approval (and thus another user) is required for enable/disable. That's a bigger change though)

This is an interesting idea and if it's something we want we should just do this now rather than adapt how enabled/disabled works again later. And that's why I wanted to post this before continuing down this road.

> I worry a bit about the performance of this.

I do too. I will need to do some testing.

> I think you'll also need to trigger a re-signing when you enable a recipe, since enabled is a part of the signed blob. Or maybe that happens automatically somewhere else.

Yeah I'll investigate this.
body_text:
This isn't really what I had expected. This creates an interesting parallel history for a recipe, sort of?

Yeah it wasn't what I was originally thinking but then I started running through workflows and this seems like the best way to handle it.

(Though maybe we should change so that approval (and thus another user) is required for enable/disable. That's a bigger change though)

This is an interesting idea and if it's something we want we should just do this now rather than adapt how enabled/disabled works again later. And that's why I wanted to post this before continuing down this road.

I worry a bit about the performance of this.

I do too. I will need to do some testing.

I think you'll also need to trigger a re-signing when you enable a recipe, since enabled is a part of the signed blob. Or maybe that happens automatically somewhere else.

Yeah I'll investigate this.
